title: i'm having a really bad experience with Riot's support team
body:
Hi,
recently i received an email from Riot games to "Reset my password" that i haven't even asked for so the first thing that came into my mind is that someone's trying to hack into my account, i directly changed my password and main Email and contacted Riot about what happened.
the first Rioter replied thinking i i lost my account and he said that he cannot help me recover it, in other meanings he didn't read exactly what happened, so yeah sure it's just a missunderstanding so i sent them another e-mail explaining that i didn't loose the account and that i just received an email about reseting the password from Riot games that i didn't ask for.
the second rioter replied the next day saying they "noticed some unusual activity on my account" and that he sent me a password reset email and that i need to check my email for a temporary password, the thing is i didn't receive anything from them which got me confused because maybe they were responsible for the first password reset email.
right after that i contacted them again asking them what sort of "unusual activity" was happening with my account and stating that i didn't receive any emails and that i changed my main email and password to be safe.
the next day a 3rd Rioter send me an email telling me he placed a proactive ban on my account to keep it safe because of the unusual activity and asked me to provide him with a different email to start a new ticket which i did as soon as i received the msg and i was extremely worried at that moment.
right after i send him the new email address he asked me for information such as things purchased first on the account etc.. to confirm my identity so i provided him with everything in details since i started playing the game on 2014.
and now i've been waiting for more than 24hours for a reply from them and there's still nothing all the previous times it took them less to respond.
when i try loggin in into my account it says "PERMANENTLY" banned which got me worried way more so i contacted that rioter again to be sure my accounts safe, and today i noticed the first ticket that i started was put on "solved" instead of open as if they already fixed my problem.
in other meanings my account's Banned for asking For riot's help after receiving an email recovery password that i did not ask for.
i can provide screenshots if needed.
Please help me out
ps:i'm on euw but i had to post this here because the euw boards are kind of dead compared to the NA boards.

replies.body:
We'll lock an account if there are concerns of unauthorized access or suspicious activity.  Your account may say banned, but that's just due to the security lock.  Our account team won't restore access to an account or recover it unless they are absolutely sure it's going back to the owner- without a shadow of a doubt.  That's why you might be asked some questions to help towards verifying that ownership.  

I know it may feel a bit of a hassle, but it's totally to protect your account from someone who might be trying to take it from you.  You can still reply to a ticket that's solved, it's not closed.  Your specialist will be able to review your response and get back to you.  Even if you fail to recover your account the first time, it's okay to try again.  Good luck!

thank you for the reply, 
can you please tell me how long is this process going to take? (verifying the ownership of the account) 
because I've sent them details about the account from the past 3 years and i can provide them with way more but i need to be kept updated about what's going on exactly because as i said sent sent over 5 messages with various questions and none of them were answered. 
thanks again for the reply, i'm a bit worried because this is the first time i encounter such a problem and i do hope it gets solved as soon as possible.

The information provided may not have been enough, so you might be asked further questions to help you out.  It can take a bit, again to be absolutely sure.  I see some tickets pertaining to you, but they aren't in English so I wouldn't be much help in this case.   Your best bet would be to continue corresponding to your specialist.  I know it may not feel like it, but I promise these guys are on your side.  Ask them any questions you have, and they'll help as much as possible.
